info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 3:20PM CDT until July 02 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Bradley County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Hamilton County in east Tennessee... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 419 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Harrison, or near Chattanooga, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Cleveland, South Cleveland, Harrison, Wildwood Lake, East Cleveland, Collegedale, Waterville, East Brainerd and Red Clay State Park. This includes Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 1 and 18. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
